resources.string:
1) The treasure can be buried in any cell on the land. 
2) Each cell on the map contains some feature (for example, a river). 
3) For each cell on the map, we can define its "neighbourhood" - this is the cell itself and all its neighbouring cells (a total of 7 cells). 
4) Each time player digs in any cell, he gets a hint. 
5) The hint indicates the number of features contained in the neighbourhood of the cell in which the player is digging, which are also contained in the neighbourhood of the cell in which the treasure is buried. 
6) The player's task is to find the treasure as quickly as possible.
